articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea's foreign minister arrived in Russia on Tuesday for talks as the Russia-Ukraine war appeared to take a dangerous new turn, with NATO and South Korea expressing alarm that North Korean troops could soon be joining in on Moscow's side.
articles.title: North Korea and Russia send political shockwaves with Ukraine war moves

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Falling debris from a destroyed Russian drone injured two people and set a residential building on fire in Kyiv, the mayor of the Ukrainian capital said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Two people injured in Russia's drone attack on Ukraine's Kyiv, mayor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 55 Palestinians were killed and dozens others wounded in an Israeli strike on a residential building in the northern Gaza town of Beit Lahiya on Tuesday, the Palestinian Civil Emergency Service said.
articles.title: At least 55 Palestinians killed in strike on Beit Lahiya, Gaza emergency service says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said on Tuesday it had elected deputy head Naim Qassem to succeed slain secretary general Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli air attack on Beirut's southern suburb over a month ago.
articles.title: Hezbollah elects Naim Qassem to succeed slain head Nasrallah

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Kamala Harris' lead over Donald Trump dwindled in the final stretch of the U.S. presidential contest, with the Democrat ahead by a single percentage point over the Republican, 44% to 43%, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll published on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris lead over Trump dwindles to a single point, 44% to 43%, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Lili Bayer
articles.description: Elections in Georgia and Moldova have shown the European Union just how tough a task it faces in trying to expand to countries that Moscow considers in its sphere of influence.
articles.title: Georgia and Moldova votes show challenges of EU enlargement push

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Darya Korsunskaya
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin kicked off a new exercise of Russia's nuclear forces on Tuesday at a critical point in the Ukraine war, the second such drill that Moscow has held in two weeks.
articles.title: Putin kicks off strategic nuclear training exercise

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche, Tom Little
articles.description: A tram derailed and crashed into a store in central Oslo on Tuesday, injuring the driver and at least three other people, Norwegian police said.
articles.title: Tram derails and crashes into shop in Oslo injuring four

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The leader of a Canadian opposition party said on Tuesday he was working to topple Prime Minister Justin Trudeau but to do so he needs the help of other legislators who have shown little enthusiasm for the idea.
articles.title: Canada opposition party tries to topple Trudeau, success not guaranteed

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: The European Union has decided to increase tariffs on Chinese-built electric vehicles to as much as 45.3% at the end of its highest profile investigation that has divided Europe and prompted retaliation from Beijing.
articles.title: EU slaps tariffs on Chinese EVs, risking Beijing payback
